intro: Capsella coronopus, commonly known as mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant has small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lobed and often covered in a fine layer of hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. Capsella coronopus is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in moist, temperate environments.
